Class wgWorkload

java.lang.Object
workloadgenerator.wgWorkload
public class wgWorkload extends Object

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    WorkloadGenerator
    parent
    Back-reference to the owning WorkloadGenerator window that collected the user inputs.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    wgWorkload(WorkloadGenerator p)
    Create a workload wrapper with a link back to the UI/controller.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • parent

      public WorkloadGenerator parent
      Back-reference to the owning WorkloadGenerator window that collected the user inputs. Used for options such as extra task toggling and accuracy scaling.

  • Constructor Details

    • wgWorkload

      public wgWorkload(WorkloadGenerator p)
      Create a workload wrapper with a link back to the UI/controller.
      Parameters:
      p - the owning WorkloadGenerator

  • Method Details

    • showInitInfo

      public void showInitInfo()
      Print initial configuration info for debugging. Outputs period and computation amount bounds to the console via println.

    • showInfo

      public void showInfo()
      Print a verbose summary of the generated workload including resource counts, each task's parameters, and total utilization. Intended for console inspection after generation.

    • creatResources

      public void creatResources()
      Create and register the resource groups for this workload.

      Currently each wgResources group is initialized with a single wgResource. The number of groups equals resourcesNumber.

    • creatTask

      public void creatTask()
      Create tasks with random parameters within configured ranges until either the task count limit is reached or the total utilization would exceed the maximum utilization. If exceeding, the last task is removed and an extra task may be created to complement utilization if enabled.

    • creatExtraTask

      public void creatExtraTask()
      Create one extra task to complement the utilization up to the configured maximum, if the gap is greater than 0.02. The extra task sets its period randomly and its computation amount based on the utilization gap.

    • creatCriticalSection

      public void creatCriticalSection()
      Generate critical sections for all tasks in this workload by delegating to wgTask.creatCriticalSection().

    • checkQuality

      public boolean checkQuality()
      Check whether the generated workload meets basic quality constraints: - Total utilization within [maximumUtilization - 0.02, maximumUtilization] - Number of tasks within configured min/max - Number of resources within configured min/max
      Returns:
      true if all constraints are satisfied; false otherwise

    • showQuality

      public String showQuality()
      Build an HTML snippet summarizing workload quality and highlighting in red any attribute that is outside its configured range.
      Returns:
      an HTML string suitable for embedding in a Swing JLabel

    • setUtilization

      public void setUtilization(double u)
      Set the maximum total utilization for the generated task set.
      Parameters:
      u - utilization upper bound (0..n)

    • setTaskNumberMin

      public void setTaskNumberMin(int number)
      Set the minimum number of tasks to attempt to create.
      Parameters:
      number - lower bound for task count

    • setTaskNumberMax

      public void setTaskNumberMax(int number)
      Set the maximum number of tasks to attempt to create.
      Parameters:
      number - upper bound for task count

    • setTaskNumber

      public void setTaskNumber()
      Determine and set the target task count based on utilization and computation/period bounds. The computed value is clamped to the configured min/max task numbers.

    • setTaskPeriodMin

      public void setTaskPeriodMin(long minimun)
      Set minimum task period.
      Parameters:
      minimun - minimum period (internal scaled units)

    • setTaskPeriodMax

      public void setTaskPeriodMax(long maximun)
      Set maximum task period.
      Parameters:
      maximun - maximum period (internal scaled units)

    • setTaskComputationTimeMin

      public void setTaskComputationTimeMin(long minimun)
      Set minimum computation amount (WCET) per task.
      Parameters:
      minimun - lower bound for computation amount

    • setTaskComputationTimeMax

      public void setTaskComputationTimeMax(long maximun)
      Set maximum computation amount (WCET) per task.
      Parameters:
      maximun - upper bound for computation amount

    • setResourcesNumbermin

      public void setResourcesNumbermin(int number)
      Set the minimum number of resource groups to create.
      Parameters:
      number - lower bound for resource group count

    • setResourcesNumbermax

      public void setResourcesNumbermax(int number)
      Set the maximum number of resource groups to create.
      Parameters:
      number - upper bound for resource group count

    • setResourcesNumber

      public void setResourcesNumber()
      Randomly choose and set the number of resource groups to create within the configured min/max range.

    • setFrequency

      public void setFrequency(int MHZ)
      Set the base CPU speed in MHz (單位: MHZ).
      Parameters:
      MHZ - CPU frequency in MHz

    • setAccessedResourceNumberMin

      public void setAccessedResourceNumberMin(int Number)
      Set the minimum number of distinct resources a task may access.
      Parameters:
      Number - lower bound on accessed resource groups

    • setAccessedResourceNumberMax

      public void setAccessedResourceNumberMax(int Number)
      Set the maximum number of distinct resources a task may access. If the provided value exceeds the number of resources configured for the workload, it is clamped to that number.
      Parameters:
      Number - upper bound on accessed resource groups

    • setMinCriticalSectionRatio

      public void setMinCriticalSectionRatio(double ratio)
      Set the minimum critical section ratio (CSR) applied when generating CS.
      Parameters:
      ratio - minimum CSR

    • setMaxCriticalSectionRatio

      public void setMaxCriticalSectionRatio(double ratio)
      Set the maximum critical section ratio (CSR) applied when generating CS.
      Parameters:
      ratio - maximum CSR

    • getXMLVersion

      public String getXMLVersion()
      Return the XML version string used in exports.
      Returns:
      XML version

      public String getXMLEncoding()
      Return the XML encoding string used in exports.
      Returns:
      XML encoding

    • getMaximumUtilization

      public double getMaximumUtilization()
      Return the configured maximum utilization.
      Returns:
      maximum utilization

    • getActualUtilization

      public double getActualUtilization()
      Return the actual utilization of the generated task set.
      Returns:
      actual utilization (sum of task utilizations)

      public int getTaskNumberMin()
      Return the configured minimum number of tasks.

      Return the configured maximum number of tasks.
      Returns:

      Returns:
